alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 1:02AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Floyd and southwestern Chattooga Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 101 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Coosa, or 11 miles west of Rome, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Summerville, Lyerly, Coosa, Berryton, Chattoogaville, James H. Floyd State Park and Holland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
